findings.title: Potential reentrancy issues
findings.description: Slither warns of several potential reentrancy issues due to external calls to trusted contracts (either Idle contracts or underlying protocols)

findings.title: Typo in IdleFulcrum contract
findings.description: There is a typo in the IdleFulcrum contract on line 91.

findings.title: Unrestricted calls to mint() in IdleCompound and IdleFulcrum
findings.description: The mint() function in IdleCompound and IdleFulcrum can be called by anyone, which may lead to unauthorized token creation. It is recommended to restrict calls to mint() to only be callable from the IdleToken contract.

findings.title: Unchecked address parameters in IdleFactory.newIdleToken()
findings.description: The newIdleToken function does not check if the provided _token address is non-zero, which may lead to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Incorrect conditional on L456 of IdleToken.sol
Unclear comment on L219 of IdleToken.sol
findings.description: The comment on line 219 of IdleToken.sol is unclear and does not accurately reflect the implementation.

findings.title: Misuse of constants in IdleCompound.sol
findings.description: Magic numbers should be replaced with named constants.

findings.title: Unchecked addresses in constructors of IdleCompound, IdleFulcrum, and IdleRebalancer
findings.description: The constructors of IdleCompound, IdleFulcrum, and IdleRebalancer do not check if the passed-in address arguments are non-zero.

findings.title: Incorrect comments on L110 and L128 of IdleRebalancer.sol
Unvalidated function arguments in IdleToken.setProtocolWrapper() and IdleFactory.setTokenOwnershipAndPauser()
findings.description: The functions setProtocolWrapper() and setTokenOwnershipAndPauser() do not validate their input arguments, which can lead to potential security issues.
